messages.message: Has anyone seen this error when trying to commit? Seems a pre-commit hook is broken on my crafting env :thread:

```(3.9.17) owner@dev:~/instabase/core-services/core-platform-service$ git add -u && git commit --amend --no-edit && git push --force
[INFO] Installing environment for https://github.com/pre-commit/mirrors-eslint.
[INFO] Once installed this environment will be reused.
[INFO] This may take a few minutes...
An unexpected error has occurred: CalledProcessError: command: ('/home/owner/.cache/pre-commit/repo20ocp9b8/node_env-system/bin/node', '/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/npm', 'install', '--include=dev', '--include=prod', '--ignore-prepublish', '--no-progress', '--no-save')
return code: 1
stdout: (none)
stderr:
    internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:818
      throw err;
      ^
    
    Error: Cannot find module 'node:path'
    Require stack:
    - /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/cli.js
    - /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/lib/node_modules/npm/bin/npm-cli.js
        at Function.Module._resolveFilename (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:815:15)
        at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:667:27)
        at Module.require (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:887:19)
        at require (internal/modules/cjs/helpers.js:85:18)
        at Object.<anonymous> (/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/cli.js:10:18)
        at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:999:30)
        at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1027:10)
        at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:863:32)
        at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:708:14)
        at Module.require (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:887:19) {
      code: 'MODULE_NOT_FOUND',
      requireStack: [
        '/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/cli.js',
        '/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/lib/node_modules/npm/bin/npm-cli.js'
      ]
    }
Check the log at /home/owner/.cache/pre-commit/pre-commit.log```
is this on the latest master?

I’m not running into this issue myself. What’s your node version?
```node --version```
also, what’s the name of your sandbox? I’ll ssh in and look around
One thing that’s weird is that your node version is wildly up to date. Like, I’m on `18.16.1` and we set that as the node version in `webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/.node-version`
Do you mind if I downgrade your node version to 18.16.1?
I’ll also rebuild webpack as well
oh hmm I'm not sure why it's like that. I can downgrade node to `18.16.1` in a bit cause I'm working on building some stuff locally right now
(also, did you install linuxbrew? Ubuntu already has `apt` :smiling_face_with_tear: )
alright, give that a shot and see how it goes
:sweat_smile: i may have installed `homebrew` when installing a package but i don't remember what it's called atm

The current version of node is managed by `linuxbrew` so it may have been the case that it autoupdated:
```owner@dev:~$ which node
/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/node```
I’m not too familiar with `homebrew` but I personally prefer Ubuntu’s inbuilt package manager because I know it works.
